item.title: Java AWT gui help
item.dc:creator: @imafatmess imafatmess
item.description:
@imafatmess wrote:

[quote=“Cheese_Police, post:17, topic:5760”][quote author=imafatmess link=topic=7671.msg81707#msg81707 date=1153591482]
Thats why you use JPanels. Looky at an example of what you can do (It has lots of stuff in it you could use if you wanted…)

[code]import java.awt.BorderLayout;
import java.awt.Cursor;
import java.awt.Dimension;
import java.awt.Image;
import java.awt.Toolkit;
import java.awt.event.ActionEvent;
import java.awt.event.ActionListener;
import java.net.MalformedURLException;
import java.net.URL;

import javax.swing.JButton;
import javax.swing.JFrame;
import javax.swing.JLabel;
import javax.swing.JPanel;

public class TutorialGUI implements ActionListener
{
private JFrame guiFrame;
private JButton tutButton;
private JLabel tutLabel = new JLabel(“Press the button”);
private JPanel guiPanel;

private TutorialGUI()
{
	guiFrame = new JFrame("GUI Tutorial 1");
	guiPanel = new JPanel(new BorderLayout());
	
	tutButton =  new JButton("Button");
	tutButton.setActionCommand("Pressed");
	tutButton.setCursor(Cursor.getPredefinedCursor(Cursor.HAND_CURSOR));
	tutButton.addActionListener(this);
    
    
	guiPanel.add(tutButton, BorderLayout.NORTH);
    
    tutLabel.setHorizontalAlignment(JLabel.CENTER);
    
    
    guiPanel.add(tutLabel, BorderLayout.SOUTH);
    
	try 
	{
		Image image = Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().getImage(new URL("http://www.fatfish.aurohost.com/" +
		"uploaded_files/mp3files/OpenedHelpFile.GIF"));
		guiFrame.setIconImage(image);
	}
	catch (MalformedURLException e) 
	{
		e.printStackTrace();
	}
	
    guiFrame.setPreferredSize(new Dimension(100, 100));
    guiFrame.add(guiPanel);
    guiFrame.pack();
    guiFrame.setDefaultCloseOperation(JFrame.EXIT_ON_CLOSE);
    guiFrame.setResizable(false);
    guiFrame.setVisible(true);
}

public static void main(String args[])
{
	new TutorialGUI();
}

public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent evt) 
{
	String c = evt.getActionCommand();
	if(c.equals("Pressed"))
	{
		tutLabel.setText("MOO!");
	}
}

}[/code]
[/quote]

Why not just import java.awt.;, java.net.;, and javax.swing.*;?[/quote]

Because I use eclipse and it did that automatically. It also makes it easier to see which classes are imported and used. It is easier to learn from and better when you look back at it.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Cheese_Police wrote:

[quote=“imafatmess, post:10, topic:5760”]Thats why you use JPanels. Looky at an example of what you can do (It has lots of stuff in it you could use if you wanted…)

[code]import java.awt.BorderLayout;
import java.awt.Cursor;
import java.awt.Dimension;
import java.awt.Image;
import java.awt.Toolkit;
import java.awt.event.ActionEvent;
import java.awt.event.ActionListener;
import java.net.MalformedURLException;
import java.net.URL;

import javax.swing.JButton;
import javax.swing.JFrame;
import javax.swing.JLabel;
import javax.swing.JPanel;

public class TutorialGUI implements ActionListener
{
private JFrame guiFrame;
private JButton tutButton;
private JLabel tutLabel = new JLabel(“Press the button”);
private JPanel guiPanel;

private TutorialGUI()
{
	guiFrame = new JFrame("GUI Tutorial 1");
	guiPanel = new JPanel(new BorderLayout());
	
	tutButton =  new JButton("Button");
	tutButton.setActionCommand("Pressed");
	tutButton.setCursor(Cursor.getPredefinedCursor(Cursor.HAND_CURSOR));
	tutButton.addActionListener(this);
    
    
	guiPanel.add(tutButton, BorderLayout.NORTH);
    
    tutLabel.setHorizontalAlignment(JLabel.CENTER);
    
    
    guiPanel.add(tutLabel, BorderLayout.SOUTH);
    
	try 
	{
		Image image = Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().getImage(new URL("http://www.fatfish.aurohost.com/" +
		"uploaded_files/mp3files/OpenedHelpFile.GIF"));
		guiFrame.setIconImage(image);
	}
	catch (MalformedURLException e) 
	{
		e.printStackTrace();
	}
	
    guiFrame.setPreferredSize(new Dimension(100, 100));
    guiFrame.add(guiPanel);
    guiFrame.pack();
    guiFrame.setDefaultCloseOperation(JFrame.EXIT_ON_CLOSE);
    guiFrame.setResizable(false);
    guiFrame.setVisible(true);
}

public static void main(String args[])
{
	new TutorialGUI();
}

public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent evt) 
{
	String c = evt.getActionCommand();
	if(c.equals("Pressed"))
	{
		tutLabel.setText("MOO!");
	}
}

}[/code][/quote]

Why not just import java.awt.;, java.net.;, and javax.swing.*;?

item.title: Java AWT gui help
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

ClassName should also be in String format, containing the entire java path of it if it is not in the same package as your class…

So, if you want to get the Class value of JFrame,

Class clazz = Class.forName("javax.swing.JFrame");

// Or, this works too:
Class clazz = javax.swing.JFrame.class;

Read full topic

item.title: Java AWT gui help
item.dc:creator: @imafatmess imafatmess
item.description:
@imafatmess wrote:

Thats why you use JPanels. Looky at an example of what you can do (It has lots of stuff in it you could use if you wanted…)

[code]import java.awt.BorderLayout;
import java.awt.Cursor;
import java.awt.Dimension;
import java.awt.Image;
import java.awt.Toolkit;
import java.awt.event.ActionEvent;
import java.awt.event.ActionListener;
import java.net.MalformedURLException;
import java.net.URL;

import javax.swing.JButton;
import javax.swing.JFrame;
import javax.swing.JLabel;
import javax.swing.JPanel;

public class TutorialGUI implements ActionListener
{
private JFrame guiFrame;
private JButton tutButton;
private JLabel tutLabel = new JLabel(“Press the button”);
private JPanel guiPanel;

private TutorialGUI()
{
	guiFrame = new JFrame("GUI Tutorial 1");
	guiPanel = new JPanel(new BorderLayout());
	
	tutButton =  new JButton("Button");
	tutButton.setActionCommand("Pressed");
	tutButton.setCursor(Cursor.getPredefinedCursor(Cursor.HAND_CURSOR));
	tutButton.addActionListener(this);
    
    
	guiPanel.add(tutButton, BorderLayout.NORTH);
    
    tutLabel.setHorizontalAlignment(JLabel.CENTER);
    
    
    guiPanel.add(tutLabel, BorderLayout.SOUTH);
    
	try 
	{
		Image image = Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().getImage(new URL("http://www.fatfish.aurohost.com/" +
		"uploaded_files/mp3files/OpenedHelpFile.GIF"));
		guiFrame.setIconImage(image);
	}
	catch (MalformedURLException e) 
	{
		e.printStackTrace();
	}
	
    guiFrame.setPreferredSize(new Dimension(100, 100));
    guiFrame.add(guiPanel);
    guiFrame.pack();
    guiFrame.setDefaultCloseOperation(JFrame.EXIT_ON_CLOSE);
    guiFrame.setResizable(false);
    guiFrame.setVisible(true);
}

public static void main(String args[])
{
	new TutorialGUI();
}

public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent evt) 
{
	String c = evt.getActionCommand();
	if(c.equals("Pressed"))
	{
		tutLabel.setText("MOO!");
	}
}

}[/code]

item.title: Java AWT gui help
item.dc:creator: @Iamadam Iamadam
item.description:
@Iamadam wrote:

Swing is Easy Peasy Basically,you just but a ‘J’ infront of everything :D. Heres how you add actionListeners to buttons.

JButton myButton = new JButton("Click Me"); myButton.addActionListener(new ActionListener() { public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent e){ System.out.println("Pressed my button"); //Stuff you wanna do when the button is pressed. } });
